text: فعميت عليهم الانۢباء يومئذ فهم لا يتساءلون

translations.translation: That Day the facts will be unclear to them and they will not be able to question one another.
Then all news will be blacked out for them, and they will not even ask one another.
Then they will not be able to think of any reply, nor will they be able to ask one another.
The door to all answers will be closed to them and they will not even be able to ask one another.
So on that Day the tidings will be blinded* for them, therefore they will not ask one another. (* They will forget at that moment).
Then the news of a good answer will be obscured to them on that Day, and they will not be able to ask one another.
Then the pleas shall become obscure to them on that day, so they shall not ask each other.
Upon that day the tidings will be darkened for them, nor will they ask each other.
On that day (all) tidings will be dimmed for them, nor will they ask one of another,
They will be left speechless on that Day, and they will not be able to consult each other.
Bedimmed unto them shall be all excuses on that Day, wherefore they shall not be able to ask one of another.
That day all information will be withheld from them, so they will not question one another.
Then the (whole) story that Day will seem obscure to them (like light to the blind) and they will not be able (even) to question each other.
Then the news of a good answer will be obscured to them on that day, and they will not be able to ask one another.
And on that Day the news will be blinded for them, and they will not ask each other.
They will be blinded by the facts on that Day, and they will not question each other.
But the information will be unapparent to them that Day, so they will not [be able to] ask one another.

[28:66] The tidings, the news of deliverance contained in the response, will be obscured to them on that day, in other words, they will not find any statement that might contain [hope of] deliverance for them; so they will not question one other, about this, and will fall silent.

commentaries.author: ابن عباس
commentaries.text: فَعَمِيَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ الْأَنْبَاءُ يَوْمَئِذٍ فَهُمْ لَا يَتَسَاءَلُونَ (66)ولهذا تفرع على ( عميت عليهم الأنباء ) قوله { فهم لا يتساءلون } أي لا يسأل بعضهم بعضاً لاستخراج الآراء وذلك من شدة البهت والبغت على الجميع أنهم لا متنصل لهم من هذا السؤال فوجموا .وإذ كان الاستفهام لتمهيد أنهم محقوقون بالعذاب علم من عجزهم عن الجواب عنه أنهم قد حق عليهم العذاب .

translations.translation: (On that day) the Day of Judgement ((all) tidings) the events and answer (will be dimmed) confused (for them, nor will they ask one of another) they will not answer one another,

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text:
وقوله تعالى: { فَعَمِيَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلأَنبَـآءُ } معناه خَفِيتْ عَلَيهِم الأَخبارُ
 وقال: الحججُ

translations.translation:
And His saying, "The news has come to them," means that the news has been hidden from them.


And he said: "The proofs {al-hujjat} are conclusive."

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
والعمل الصالح والاجتناب عن المحظورات وترك المنكرات { فَعَمِيَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلأَنبَـآءُ يَوْمَئِذٍ } يعني: ضلوا وتحيروا عن جميع طرق الكلام
 وسُدت عليهم سبل الأجوبة والإخبار مطلقاً
 وذلك من كمال دهشتهم وحيرتهم
 وشدة عمههم وسكرتهم { فَهُمْ } يومئذٍ من غاية ولههم وحيرتهم { لاَ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ } [القصص: 66] ولا تقاولون
 أي: لا يسأل بعضهم بعضاً حتى يعلمه
 بل كلهم حينئذٍ حيارى سكارى
 تائهين هائمين
 لا يُسمع لهم ولا يتأتى منهم الالتفات والتلقي أصلاً

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
{ فهم لا يتساءلون } لا يسأل بعضهم بعضاً عن الجواب لفرط الدهشة
 أو: عن العذر والحجة
 عسى أن يكون عندهم عذر أو حجة
